bl.postprocessor
Class ArffWriter

java.lang.Object
  bl.postprocessor.ArffWriter

public class ArffWriter
extends java.lang.Object

Generates an ARFF file out of an ParSeMiS fragments file. Each annotation of each edge (the set of all edges of all fragments) becomes an attribute. Each super-graph (the embedding) becomes a row. The value in a cell is the value of the annotation of that edge (column) in an embedding (row).

Author:
Christopher Oßner

Field Detail

FAILING_INDICATOR

private static final java.lang.String FAILING_INDICATOR
String that indicates that a graph is from a failing execution. Supposed to be found at the end of a graph-name. Graph-names matching this String will be class failed.

See Also:

ArffWriter(java.lang.String input,
           java.lang.String output)
Deprecated. 

Sets up the file handlers.

Parameters:
input - location of the input, an enhanced fragments file
output - where to store the output ARFF

ArffWriter

ArffWriter(java.lang.String input,
           java.lang.String output,
           java.lang.String graphDB)

ArffWriter

public ArffWriter(java.lang.String input,
                  java.lang.String output,
                  java.lang.String graphDB,
                  boolean reincludeDummies,
                  boolean reincludeJre)
Sets up the file handlers.

Parameters:
input - location of the input, an (unified) ParSeMiS fragments file
output - where to store the output ARFF
graphDB - path to the serialized graph objects that were used to create the fragments file
reincludeDummies - If dummy vertices were omitted during the graph mining step
reincludeJre - if calls to JRE shall be included to the ARFF, set true (when the LG was wrote), they can be re-included through setting this variable true.

Triggers the process.

public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,ArffWriter.FragmentStatistic>> getStatistics()
If statistics is null, exec() will be called.

Returns:
statistics unordered

toStringStatistics

public java.lang.String toStringStatistics()

addCells

private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> addCells(java.lang.String graphname,
                                                                      java.util.ArrayList<Edge> edges,
                                                                      java.lang.String fragmentName)
We add only those cells per row, that are not NULL. We also add each attribute to allAttributes. Cells resulting from the current fragment are added to table to those, that are already present there.

Parameters:
graphname - name of the embedding graph
edges - all edges of the current fragment
fragmentName - name of the current fragment
Returns:
graphname -> attributes (attributes from table plus those new in the current fragment)

reincludeDummies

private java.util.ArrayList<Edge> reincludeDummies(callgraph.AdjacenceList graph,
                                                   java.util.ArrayList<Edge> edgesIn)
Looks up dummies in the serialized graphs and generated additional attributes for each edge to and from the dummies. Dummies (foreign package, foreign class) are included if reincludeDummies is set. Calls to JRE are included, if reincludeJre is set.

Parameters:
graphname - name of the graph to look up
edges - the current edges for that graph
Returns:
the edges passed as parameter + the dummy additions

writeOutput

private void writeOutput(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> table)
                  throws java.io.IOException

Throws:
java.io.IOException
